testScenarios.name: Family Tax Optimization
testScenarios.description: Test family tax benefits and optimization strategies
assertions: Childcare expenses should be deductible by lower-income spouse
Canada Child Benefit should be calculated correctly
Spousal amount should be available if applicable

testScenarios.name: Childcare Expense Deduction
testScenarios.description: Test childcare expense calculations and limits
assertions: Childcare expenses should be limited by income and per-child limits
Deduction should be claimed by lower-income spouse
Age-based limits should be applied correctly

testScenarios.name: Investment Income Taxation
testScenarios.description: Test taxation of various investment income types
assertions: Dividend gross-up should be calculated correctly
Dividend tax credit should reduce tax owing
Capital gains should be taxed at 50% inclusion rate

testScenarios.name: Alberta Tax Calculation
assertions: Alberta flat tax rate should be applied correctly
Alberta family employment tax credit if applicable

testScenarios.name: Dual Income Family Benefits
testScenarios.description: Test family benefits for dual-income households
assertions: Family net income should determine benefit amounts
Benefits should phase out appropriately with income
Both spouses should contribute to family income calculation

notes: Typical dual-income family scenario with common family expenses
Tests childcare deductions and family benefits
Should benefit from progressive tax system and family credits
Investment income adds complexity to tax calculation
Alberta's flat provincial tax rate simplifies provincial calculations
